revisions.rev:
{{Infobox football biography | name = Fernando Cavenaghi | image = [[File:Cavenaghi.JPG|250px]] | caption = | fullname = Fernando Ezequiel Cavenaghi | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|9|21}} | birth_place = [[O'Brien, Argentina]] | height = {{height|m=1.81}} | currentclub = [[Club AtlÃ©tico River Plate|River Plate]] | clubnumber = 9 | position = [[Striker]] | youthyears1= | youthclubs1= | years1 = 2001â2004 | clubs1 = [[Club AtlÃ©tico River Plate|River Plate]] | caps1 = 121 | goals1 = 71 | years2 = 2004â2007 | clubs2 = [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] | caps2 = 51 | goals2 = 12 | years3 = 2007â2011 | clubs3 = [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] | caps3 = 83 | goals3 = 33 | years4 = 2010 | clubs4 = â [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]] (loan) | caps4 = 11 | goals4 = 2 | years5 = 2011 | clubs5 = â [[Sport Club Internacional|Internacional]] (loan) | caps5 = 2 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2011â | clubs6 = [[Club AtlÃ©tico River Plate|River Plate]] | caps6 = 15 | goals6 = 13 | nationalyears1 = 2003 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U-20]] | nationalcaps1 = 13 | nationalgoals1 = 12 | nationalyears2 = 2008â | nationalteam2 = [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | pcupdate = August 16, 3011 | ntupdate = August 16, 2011 }} '''Fernando Ezequiel Cavenaghi''' (born September 21, 1983 in [[O'Brien, Argentina|O'Brien]]) is an [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[football (soccer)|football]] player who currently plays for [[Club AtlÃ©tico River Plate|River Plate]] in the second division.
==Career== Cavenaghi made his debut for [[Club AtlÃ©tico River Plate|River Plate]] in the 2000/2001 season in which he scored one goal in 5 appearances. In his first full season he scored 17 goals in 23 appearances including a hat-trick against [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]]. He left River at the beginning of the 2004/2005 season joining [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] for a fee of Â£6.5 million. During his time at River he scored 55 times in 89 appearances.
In the 2005 season, playing for Spartak Moscow, Cavenaghi scored 7 goals in 26 appearances (compared with 14 for Kirichenko â the season's top-scorer) and played his part in helping Spartak win a UEFA Champions League place. It was a difficult first season for Cavenaghi, however, as he struggled to cope with an unfamiliar style of play, the artificial pitches and the Russian language.
Although he started the 2006 season better than the previous one, he faded in the second half and transfer rumors began to surface.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} On 22 January 2007, Cavenaghi was sold to [[Ligue 1|French]] division club [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] for an undisclosed fee, although the Russian media speculated that the deal was worth approximately â¬11 million with possible future fees.
He was a part of the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina Under-20]] squad that finished fourth in the [[2003 FIFA World Youth Championship]].
On February 3, 2007 he played his first [[Ligue 1]] match for Bordeaux against [[OGC Nice|Nice]]. Cavenaghi has been a hero lately because of his famous 10 goals in 9 matches.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tactical Formation|work=Football-Lineups.com |url=http://www.football-lineups.com/footballer/5963/ | accessdate=March 4, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ligue 1 Top Scorer of the Month February, 2008|work=frenchleague.com |url=http://www.frenchleague.com/ligue1/lireArticle.asp?origine=RSS&idArticle=9816 | accessdate=March 3, 2008}}</ref> This performance also brought him to the attention of [[Alfio Basile]] who called him up for the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]] and gave him his debut against [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] on March 26, 2008.
On the summer of 2011, Fernando returned to his childhood club River Plate in order to help out after the historic relegation, to second division, of the Argentine giants. Cavenaghi, who had great success in River Plate during the early years of his career and at Bordeaux, will now be the captain of the team. He has since voiced his intentions to stay at River Plate until retirement.
